education.description: During my years at Stetson, I studied physics, where I learned about proper laboratory safety skills and developed my skills at presenting my results in front of my peers. I would also help my classmates whenever they needed help with their work, and return they helped me. Furthermore, I worked as a TA for an Intro to University Physics class in my senior year where I graded students' work and set up office hours for them to come and ask for help. I also took a couple of coding classes where I learned the basics of software development.

relevantClasses.name: Intro to Computer Science
relevantClasses.description: In this class, I learned the basics of Python and its uses in Data Science. I created a SIR (Susceptible-Infected-Recovery) graph using predictive modeling and data as well as made a mini neural network.

relevantClasses.name: Intro to Software Development
relevantClasses.description: I learned the basics of C++ and its uses in software development. I made a program that was able to take data about car sales and specifications from a csv file and find the mean, median, and range of each 'column'. I was also able to make an Animal guessing game using a binary search tree.

relevantClasses.name: Modern Physics
relevantClasses.description: In one of our labs, I used Python to create a half-life simulator to determine the average half-life of Barium-137.

relevantClasses.name: Senior Research Project
relevantClasses.description: I made the software that would read the temperature of a cryostat submerged in liquid nitrogen, put it through a PID loop, and use the output to gradually increase or decrease the temperature to whatever I desired. The software also recorded and saved the data found onto my computer as a .txt file that would be used to make graphs. Furthermore, I presented my results once a week to my peers and colleagues and at the end of the year, presented my results in a public setting while briefly explaining by research.
